summary:
How can you lead consumers to choose your brand and influence their buying
decision process? What are the consumers’ needs and how can you respond
to it to develop your business? What are the keys do create customer loyalty
and remarkable shopping experience? This is the kind of questions that keeps
me up at night. And what drives my career.

My job is to provide meaningful key insights from consumers to help you better
understand your customers and contribute to build a brilliant marketing strategy,
an awesome shopping experience and great products that will appeal to consumers
and make them happy. So that in the end, it helps you meet your business goals
and increase your sales.

ROI-driven with a scientific background and a business-oriented mindset, I leverage
and transform consumer and shopper insights into actionable recommendations and profit.
Delivering results on time, proactivity, “can do” attitude, entrepreneurial spirit and passion
are part of my professional DNA.

After a MA in Behavioral Sciences, I’ve started as a Junior Market Research Analyst
in a digital marketing agency where I provided insights and recommendations that
- combined with an effective digital marketing strategy - led to 266% increase in
online sales for the account (a B2C company) i've worked on.

Wishing to strengthen my expertise, I’ve decided to expand my skills with
a Master's Degree in Market Research and Marketing Management.

After a first experience as CMI Assistant for Unilever Hair Europe, I am now CMI Associate for Global Hair Dove & Nexxus.

certifications.name: An Introduction to Marketing - The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania

projects.title: Startup Weekend Bretagne
projects.description:
Organization of the second edition of Startup Weekend Bretagne in march 2012 in Rennes, France with the support of Orange France, Microsoft, Google and Rennes School of Business.

The event, in which each team has to work on a new complete project of startup company during a whole weekend, brought together more than 120 happy and enthusiastic participants.

projects.title: Consumer & Market Research Project - Pringles - Kellogg's
projects.description:
Planning and running a complete ad hoc market research project for the « Pringles » brand (The Kellogg Company) in France. The objective of this Market Research Project is to meet the goals and challenges of the « Pringles » brand in the salty snacks market in France.

- Designing and running a complete ad hoc market research project from a research brief from Kellogg's for its « Pringles » brand in France.
- Creating and conducting a quantitative research (survey).
- Collecting and organizing data.
- Managing processes, budget and deadlines.
- Data mining & data analysis (with SPSS)
- Writing a Market Research Report
- Devising specific recommendations from the market research project for the client (Kellogg's) and the "Pringles" brand.
- Giving a presentation in front of the brand executives.

profile_positions.description:
In the Unilever CMI department for Skin Cleansing, I am working on all of Unilever's Skin Cleansing Brands in Europe.

My tasks include:

- Monitoring brands' performances including Axe, Dove, Dove Men + Care, Radox, Duschdas, Zwitsal, Fissan on the European market.
- Identifying tactical opportunities in the category
- Market reporting (monitoring business performance, analyzing trends and summarizing key conclusions and recommendations)
- Monitoring competitors' activity and performances in the category
- Supporting the coordination of market research projects
-Setting-up Primary and Secondary Researches
-Leverage existing knowledge and doing desk research
-Connecting marketers and consumers via recruitment and talk
profile_positions.title: Intern - CMI Skin Cleansing - EU brands

profile_positions.description:
I'm the Founder & Editor-In-Chief of TheConsumerFactor.com - a website dedicated to Consumer Insights, Market Research, Shopper Insights, Consumer Behavior, Shopper Marketing and Neuromarketing.

How consumers choose a brand? What are the factors involved in the buying decision process? How to understand consumers' needs and respond to it? How to create customer loyalty and improve shopping experience? How to use data, sensory marketing or neuromarketing to increase a store's sales?

These are some of the many topics covered on TheConsumerFactor.com. You'll also find out on the website: actual marketing examples, interviews with industry executives, case studies and industry news.

As Editor-In-Chief, I also have attended and covered some of the major events in the industry (The Shopper Insights in Action Event, etc.) and met or interviewed executives from top global companies (The Coca-Cola Company, Tesco, Kellogg's, PepsiCo, etc.)

I have also written and published an ebook: "The Forces that Drive Consumer Behavior... and How to Learn from it to Increase Your Sales."

PS: The website is available both in english and in french.
profile_positions.title: Founder & Editor-In-Chief

profile_positions.description:
The Journal of Brand Strategy (Henry Stewart Publications) is a major professional journal publishing in-depth, peer-reviewed articles for all those involved in marketing.

As Editorial Board Member, my job is to review some of the submitted articles in my area of expertise (Consumer Insights and Behavior) and suggesting topics for articles for the next issues. As well as help and advice for the Journal's promotion strategy.
profile_positions.title: Editorial Board Member

profile_positions.description:
The Consumer Mind Connection is a website dedicated to students, graduates and young professionals (less than 5 years of experience in the industry) interested or involved in fields such as Consumer Insights, Market Research, Consumer Behavior, Shopper Insights, Neuromarketing and Consumer Psychology.

The Consumer Mind Connection provides information and resources such as: 

- A specific job board with internships, graduate jobs and positions for young professionals with less than 5 years of experience
- A career section with specific information on the industry
- A listing of the industry’s trade associations (including the specific membership rate for students and / or young professionals)
- A listing of the industry’s publications and magazines
- A directory of trade associations and training companies offering specific courses and professional certifications related to Market Research, Consumer Insights and marketing
- A listing of the academic degrees provided by universities, colleges and business schools worldwide in Market Research, Consumer Insights and Consumer Behaviour
- An industry events calendar
- And more!

The website's goal is to give students and young professionals all the resources and information they need in order to enter in the industry and advance in their career.
profile_positions.title: Founder & Executive Director

profile_positions.description:
SeriesLive.com is one of the french leading website about media industry, television & TV shows with hundreds of thousands of visitors each month.

As Staff Writer & Editor, I wrote and published articles, news and reports about TV and media industry.

I also have attended and covered some of the world major events in the media industry (MipTV and MipCom, Monte-Carlo Television Festival, Comic-Con Paris, etc.) where I've conducted and published interviews with well-known TV celebrities and key leaders of the media and entertainment industry.

Besides that, I have joined the team of « The SeriesLive Show » : one of the leading french podcasts about TV shows and media industry.
profile_positions.title: Staff Writer & Editor

profile_positions.description:
Lemon Factory is a digital marketing agency with a strong ROI-driven philosophy. Insights, research and data play a key part in the agency's methodology in order to provide strong results to clients.

Responsibilities include:

- Designing and planning of market research studies & Planning and performing quantitative research (surveys, customer questionnaires, etc.) and qualitative research (focus groups, in-depth interviews, etc.)
- Performing competitive analysis and secondary research from existing data
- Collecting and analyzing data
- Developping buyer personas from collected data
- Transforming data into actionable insights and recommendations for the development of clients’ marketing strategy (writing strategic reports and giving meaningful presentations) 

 Results achieved: On the account (a B2C company) I've worked on, the insights and recommendations I provided - combined with an effective digital marketing strategy - led to an increase of 266% in online sales.
profile_positions.title: Junior Market Research Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Summary: With the global support of Google for Entrepreneurs and Coca-Cola, Startup Weekend has become a well-known and appreciative organization in the startup and entrepreneurial ecosystem worldwide.

A Startup Weekend is a « 54-hour event where developers, designers, marketers, product managers and startup enthusiasts come together to share ideas, form team, build products and launch startups. »

Responsibilities:

- Organization of the 2nd edition of the Startup Weekend Bretagne in march 2012 in Rennes, France.
- Organization and Promotion of the event & Budget management ($10,000)
- Management and coordination of the team’s work (10+ people) under pressure and facing tight deadlines
- Acquiring and securing corporate sponsors (Orange, Microsoft, Google, etc.) as well as well-known speakers of the industry for the event

Results achieved: The event has been a huge success. It brought together 120+ happy and enthusiastic participants during a whole weekend and received good press coverage from local and trade media.
profile_positions.title: Organizer Startup Weekend Bretagne #2

profile_positions.description:
During my research internship at University College London, I worked on a scientific study conducted under the direction of Dr Alex Alvergne, titled "Identification of facial cues to paternity in humans"

Responsibilities:

- Recruitment of participants for the study & Conducting interviews with selected participants
- Datamining & data analysis
- Secondary research & Report writing

Results achieved: This study led to the publication of an article in the scientific journal « Biology Letters ».
